subject: Re: [junit] JUnit works great in IDE, how do I run it from a shell?
msgSnippet: ... First off, have you got the prerequisites? I would imagine Netbeans bundles its own version of ANT and JUnit, which is why it works in the IDE.

First off, hav=
e you got the prerequisites? I would imagine Netbeans
bundles its own versi=
on of ANT and JUnit, which is why it works in the
IDE.

rg/manual/OptionalTasks/junit.html
